dataList.content: Haah, huff... Gotcha, you slippery bastard!
The child was backed into a dead end. And on the other side of the alley was someone chasing him.
The pursuer held a long sword with two hands and took deep, slow breaths, looking ready to tear the child into two any moment.
There's...nowhere to run. Hah, so stop wasting my energy and...
While the pursuer was busy talking...
Hey! Where'd you...
The child rumbled and tumbled, making a loud exit into a gap in the right.
The pursuer mumbles harsh words, slowly moving toward the end of the alley where the child vanished.
An iron door covered in red rust. This must be where the child hid.
Damn... Thought you were clever, hiding into a tight space where long weapons are no good, eh?
Chuckling to themselves, the pursuer put the sword in the waist and pulled out a shorter blade.
Idiot, there's a reason I carry two swords all the time... Kekeh.
The pursuer enters the door with a wicked cackle.
Alas, little did they know that they were walking into a trap.

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: Got...you.
Wha?!
The child was nowhere to be found when they looked around, but now he suddenly stands behind them.
They couldn't believe it.
H-how...

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: I don't care if your sword is long or short... No ingredient that crawled into my "workroom" has ever made it out alive.
I-ingredient...?

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: Yep. You, pal...have been fooled.
That's when the pursuer finally realized.
That they had chased the child...into the streets of flavor.

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: So why'd you start a fight with a random passerby like that... I was just casually strolling, and now you got me curious of your meat quality.
D-does that mean this is... Ryōshū's...
The pursuer, now reduced to a miserable prey, fearfully murmured.
Even a new blood still unfamiliar with the neighborhood's layout has heard of the place: the restaurant that makes pies out of human meat.

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: Hsssh... I really don't get why she has to be the one our establishment's named after.

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: Hey, don't you think so, too? My work's vital in every step of the cooking: from procuring ingredients to cutting, trimming, and preparing the meat. So why can't my name be hung out?
Light taps with the back of an old cleaver.
The child pours out his complaints, poking the nervous prey on the shoulder.
C-certainly! Your name deserves to be in the restaurant's name, sir!

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: Psh, don't be like that. Quite the sharp turn from calling me a bastard... That sudden "sir" gives me the creeps.
M-my apologies!

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: ...Don't be. It's not gonna make me let you go, y'know.
S-sir! If you're that confident in your abilities, then you should kill whoever's put her name forward and rightfully take her spot! I-I can help...

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: Ah geez, you're awfully noisy.
The conversation ended there, and the room was filled with sounds of chopping and slicing.

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: Well... I appreciate the nice words, pal. But I can't make pasty hand pies out of flattery.
The child mutters, his hands busy with the sloppy lumps.
Even though there was no one to hear him.

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: Sure, she gets on my nerves and threatens to fire me all the time...

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: She's not a bad cook to learn from... I gotta behave for now. For now.

dataList.title: District 23 Backstreets
dataList.content: So don't be too sullen, pal. I might have hesitated if you were a distinguished chef. Heh.
If the child is standing by for now, what does he plan to do down the line? It's a curious thing to think about...
But, well, this doesn't look like the right time to be idly wondering about such things. Right?
